title: Indigenous food systems biocultural heritage and the SDGs (session four)

tasks.task: Participate in interdisciplinary research methods for Indigenous People's Food Systems
subtasks: Collaborate with ethnobotanists to document crop diversity and uses
Organize historical documentation and archaeological data for long-term crop histories
Implement participatory action research involving community mapping, inventory, and garden creation
Develop ethnobotanical botanical linguistics to understand Indigenous food systems
Create accessible ethnobiological databases and use botanical science for conserving orphan crops
Facilitate community-led research through citizen science, participant-led mapping, and suite of conservation methods
Document Indigenous food systems using interdisciplinary methods and oral history
Support community-owned knowledge transmission and storytelling for food sovereignty
Address land rights and policy-level engagement for sustainable food systems preservation
Revitalize cultural traditions and recipes through community-owned restaurants and commercialization
Acknowledge and respect Indigenous research methodologies and decolonize research practices
